descript.abstract: This line data layer represents roads for Sauk County, Wisconsin in 2016. It is a feature class within the geodatabase, Sauk_Roads_2016.gdb.[This feature class contains detailed line work supporting Sauk Counties road network and contains street name, classification, and address range attributes]
descript.purpose:
This layer is intended for reference and mapping purposes, and may be used for basic applications such as viewing, querying, and map output production, or to provide a basemap to support graphical overlays and analysis with other spatial data.
[A comprehensive road centerline and MSAG address range database to support geocoding and official mapping products]
descript.supplinf: Augmented original metadata with UW-Madison specific elements. For complete metadata documentation, please visit http://saukgis.maps.arcgis.com/home/index.html

idinfo.useconst: [The information provided via Sauk County GIS online is provided 'as is' and for reference only. The user expressly agrees that use of the Sauk County's web site is at the user's sole risk. Sauk County does not warrant that the service will be uninterrupted or error free. The maps, layers and reports published on this server could contain technical inaccuracies or typographical errors. Changes may be made periodically to parcel boundaries, legal descriptions, boundaries of other layers and similar materials; these changes may or may not be incorporated in any new materials on the web site. Information in these maps is copied from public records of the Sauk County Register of Deeds and Surveyor's offices. While intended to be as accurate as possible, no warranty is made as to the accuracy of materials produced. These maps should not be relied upon as a substitute for an actual field survey.Sauk County makes every effort to produce and publish the most current and accurate information possible. Sauk County nor its partners, providers, or affiliates make any representations or warranties of any kind, express or implied, as to the operation of the service, its contents, or any information made available by or through the service. Sauk County does not guarantee the accuracy of the material contained herein and is not responsible for any misuse or misrepresentation of this information or its derivatives. IN NO EVENT WILL SAUK COUNTY GOVERNMENT, ITS SUPPLIERS, ITS SERVICE PROVIDERS, OR OTHER THIRD PARTY AFFILIATES BE LIABLE FOR ANY DAMAGE ARISING OUT OF THE USE, INABILITY TO USE, OR THE RESULTS OF USE OF THIS SERVICE.Protection of Proprietary RightsReproduction or redistribution of licensed data sets or products derived therefrom outside of Licensee’s organization or entity, without the express, written consent of Sauk County through the Sauk County Land Information Office, is forbidden, except as expressly provided as follows.1. Redistribution of licensed data sets to consultants working for the Licensee is permitted only for purposes related to Licensee’s business. Such consultants may not further reproduce or redistribute said licensed data sets, and such copies must be returned to Licensee upon completion of the consultants’work.2. Reproduction or redistribution of hard copies derived from licensed data sets is permitted for noncommercial purposes only (e.g. government agency publication or use by a non-profit organization) provided proper credits are printed on each copy. (See ‘Credits’below.) LiabilityThe burden for determining ‘fitness for use’rests entirely upon the requester/Licensee. Sauk County and its coproducers will not be liable in any way for accuracy of the data, and assume no responsibility whatsoever for direct, indirect, special, consequential, exemplary or other damages. Licensee agrees to indemnify, hold harmless and defend Sauk County, its employees, agents, representatives and co-producers from any and all claims, damages, liabilities and expenses arising from Licensee’s use of licensed data sets or products derived therefrom.UpdatesSaid licensed data sets are licensed and distributed ‘as is’on a one-time basis. Sauk County is under no obligation to inform Licensee of data updates, alterations, or accuracy errors discovered thereafter. The burden of ordering and paying for updated copies of data sets rests entirely upon Licensee. Revisions may be made at Sauk County’s discretion on a time and funding available basis.CreditsAny paper copies derived in whole or in part from said licensed data sets shall clearly indicate their source and copyright. If Licensee modifies the data in any way whatsoever, Licensee is obligated to describe the modifications performed on the paper copy map. Any altered graphic elements shall be clearly symbolized to distinguish them from original graphics contained within licensed data sets. Licensee specifically agrees not to misrepresent Sauk County licensed data sets, nor to imply that changes made by Licensee were approved by Sauk County unless express written permission is received from the Sauk County Land Information Office.]

cntinfo.cntinst: Additional Contact Persons: Kelly Felton (Cartographer/LIO) (608)355-3240 kfelton@co.sauk.wi.us Sally Cobb (GIS Specialist) (608)355-3562 scobb@co.sauk.wi.us

attracc.attraccr: Attribute information remains the same as given by the author of the data.

procstep.procdesc: Changed name of file from ‘RoadCenterlines’ to Sauk_Roads_2016
Exported original feature class into a new file geodatabase to maintain the original file format of the data and to conform to UW-Madison's data distribution plan.

mapproj.mapprojn: NAD 1983 HARN WISCRS Sauk County Feet

attr.attrdef: Internal feature number.

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: Feature geometry.
The alternate federal route name
A functional classification of federal route that can be used to further classify the route if different than the ROADCLASS
The alternate state route name
A functional classification of route that can be used to symbolize the route if detail beyond what is provided in ROADCLASS is needed
A unique id for the road centerline segment
Census Feature Classification Code for road
The county route name
The ESN on left side of the road
The ESN on right side of the road
The federal route name
A functional classification of route that can be used to symbolize the route if detail beyond what is provided in ROADCLASS is needed
Lowest address range on left side of the road
Lowest address range on right side of the road
The full name of the road including any prefix and/or suffix in mixed case format for Esri Community Map contributors
A flag that indicates whether the segment of the road is crossing water
The MSAG community on left side of the road
The MSAG community on right side of the road
Municipal name on left side of the road
Municipal name on right side of the road
A code that indicates whether the traffic flows with, or against, the direction of the vertices
Functional classification of roads based on type of service
A code that indicates whether the traveled roadway is above or below grade
The state route name
A functional classification of route that can be used to symbolize the route if detail beyond what is provided in ROADCLASS is needed
Highest address range on left side of the road
Highest address range on right side of the road
Zip code on left side of the road
Zip code on right side of the road
Road Prefix Direction
Base Road Name
Road Type
Road Post Direction
Alternate Road Name
Second Alternate Road Name
Second Alternate State Route
Second Alternate State Route Type
Alternate County Route
Used to support Sauk Counties symbolization of road network in mapping products.

Developed - Current in use road network Undeveloped - Platted roads that have not been developed. Planned - Platted roads that we believe will one day be developed. Retired - Road that have been retired Developed-Outliers - Roads outside Sauk County extent.
Many sources were brought together to create this feature class, this field describes the origin source of the centerline.
Used on case of emergency to notify the public of closed roads
Populated in cases were the Fire Number road name does not match the current road name.
MSAG Road Prefix Direction supports a standards used by the E911 application.
MSAG Road Name supports a standards used by the E911 application.
MSAG Road Type supports a standards used by the E911 application.
MSAG Road Post Direction supports a standards used by the E911 application.
MSAG Full Road Name supports a standards used by the E911 application.
Centerline date created
Lowest MSAG address range on left side of the road. These ranges support entire ranges of a block, not the actual range.
Hightest MSAG address range on left side of the road. These ranges support entire ranges of a block, not the actual range.
Lowest MSAG address range on right side of the road. These ranges support entire ranges of a block, not the actual range.
Highest MSAG address range on right side of the road. These ranges support entire ranges of a block, not the actual range.
Globally Unique Indentifier
Length of feature in internal units.

attrdomv.udom: Positive real numbers that are automatically generated.
